push-up.name: Push-up
push-up.description: A classic bodyweight exercise that works the chest, shoulders, and triceps. Keep your body straight and core engaged.

pull-up.name: Pull-up
pull-up.description: An advanced bodyweight exercise that targets the back and biceps using an overhand grip.

chin-up.name: Chin-up
chin-up.description: A bodyweight exercise targeting the back and biceps using an underhand grip, often emphasizing biceps more than pull-ups.

bodyweight-squat.name: Bodyweight Squat
bodyweight-squat.description: A fundamental lower body exercise engaging quads, glutes, and hamstrings without external weight.

lunge.name: Lunge
lunge.description: A unilateral leg exercise that improves balance, stability, and strengthens quads, glutes, and hamstrings.

plank.name: Plank
plank.description: An isometric core strength exercise that involves maintaining a position similar to a push-up for the maximum possible time.

burpee.name: Burpee
burpee.description: A full-body, high-intensity exercise combining a squat, push-up, and jump.

dip-bar.name: Dip (Bar)
dip-bar.description: A compound bodyweight exercise primarily targeting the triceps and chest, performed on parallel bars.

barbell-bench-press.name: Barbell Bench Press
barbell-bench-press.description: A fundamental compound exercise for upper body strength, primarily targeting the chest, shoulders, and triceps.

barbell-back-squat.name: Barbell Back Squat
barbell-back-squat.description: A core strength exercise targeting the quads, glutes, hamstrings, and lower back by squatting with a barbell on the upper back.

barbell-deadlift.name: Barbell Deadlift (Conventional)
barbell-deadlift.description: A full-body compound exercise lifting a barbell off the floor to a standing position, engaging legs, back, and core.

overhead-press-barbell.name: Overhead Press (Barbell)
overhead-press-barbell.description: A compound shoulder exercise pressing a barbell overhead from a standing or seated position.

bent-over-row-barbell.name: Bent-Over Row (Barbell)
bent-over-row-barbell.description: A compound back exercise where a barbell is pulled towards the torso while bent at the hips.

barbell-bicep-curl.name: Barbell Bicep Curl
barbell-bicep-curl.description: An isolation exercise for the biceps using a barbell.

barbell-romanian-deadlift.name: Barbell Romanian Deadlift (RDL)
barbell-romanian-deadlift.description: Targets hamstrings and glutes by hinging at the hips with a slight knee bend, keeping the barbell close to the legs.

dumbbell-bench-press.name: Dumbbell Bench Press
dumbbell-bench-press.description: A compound exercise that targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps using dumbbells on a bench, allowing for greater range of motion.

dumbbell-shoulder-press.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
dumbbell-shoulder-press.description: A compound shoulder exercise pressing dumbbells overhead, allowing for independent arm movement.

dumbbell-row.name: Dumbbell Row (Single Arm)
dumbbell-row.description: A unilateral back exercise targeting lats, rhomboids, and biceps, typically performed with one knee and hand on a bench.

dumbbell-bicep-curl.name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
dumbbell-bicep-curl.description: An isolation exercise for biceps using dumbbells, allowing for supination (wrist rotation).

dumbbell-tricep-extension-overhead.name: Dumbbell Overhead Tricep Extension
dumbbell-tricep-extension-overhead.description: An isolation exercise for triceps, performed by extending a dumbbell overhead.

dumbbell-lunge.name: Dumbbell Lunge
dumbbell-lunge.description: Lunges performed while holding dumbbells, adding resistance to the lower body.

dumbbell-romanian-deadlift.name: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift (RDL)
dumbbell-romanian-deadlift.description: Targets hamstrings and glutes using dumbbells, focusing on hip hinge movement.

goblet-squat.name: Goblet Squat
goblet-squat.description: A squat variation holding a single dumbbell or kettlebell at chest level, promoting an upright torso.

dumbbell-lateral-raise.name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
dumbbell-lateral-raise.description: An isolation exercise for the medial (side) deltoids, lifting dumbbells out to the sides.

dumbbell-front-raise.name: Dumbbell Front Raise
dumbbell-front-raise.description: An isolation exercise for the anterior (front) deltoids, lifting dumbbells forward.

kettlebell-swing.name: Kettlebell Swing (Two-Handed)
kettlebell-swing.description: A dynamic, explosive exercise targeting the posterior chain (glutes, hamstrings, back) and improving power.

kettlebell-goblet-squat.name: Kettlebell Goblet Squat
kettlebell-goblet-squat.description: A squat holding a kettlebell by the horns at chest level, excellent for form and core engagement.

kettlebell-clean-and-press.name: Kettlebell Clean and Press
kettlebell-clean-and-press.description: A full-body compound movement involving cleaning a kettlebell to the rack position and then pressing it overhead.

turkish-get-up.name: Turkish Get-Up (TGU)
turkish-get-up.description: A complex, full-body exercise involving transitioning from lying on the floor to standing, all while holding a kettlebell (or dumbbell) overhead. Enhances stability, mobility, and strength.

kettlebell-single-arm-row.name: Kettlebell Single Arm Row
kettlebell-single-arm-row.description: A unilateral back exercise targeting lats, rhomboids, and biceps, performed by pulling a kettlebell towards the torso, often with one hand and knee supported on a bench.

kettlebell-deadlift.name: Kettlebell Deadlift
kettlebell-deadlift.description: A foundational strength exercise using one or two kettlebells to target the posterior chain, focusing on a hip hinge movement. Can be done with kettlebell(s) between feet or outside (suitcase style).

kettlebell-strict-press.name: Kettlebell Strict Press (Single Arm)
kettlebell-strict-press.description: An overhead pressing exercise for shoulder and tricep strength, performed with a single kettlebell from the rack position without using leg drive.

kettlebell-rack-lunge.name: Kettlebell Lunge (Rack Position)
kettlebell-rack-lunge.description: A unilateral leg exercise that builds strength, stability, and core engagement, performed while holding one or two kettlebells in the front rack position.

kettlebell-windmill.name: Kettlebell Windmill
kettlebell-windmill.description: A complex exercise that improves shoulder stability, hip mobility, and core strength, involving hinging sideways at the hips while keeping a kettlebell locked out overhead.

kettlebell-russian-twist.name: Kettlebell Russian Twist
kettlebell-russian-twist.description: A core exercise targeting the obliques and rectus abdominis, performed by sitting with knees bent and feet off the ground (optional), twisting the torso from side to side while holding a kettlebell.

kettlebell-high-pull.name: Kettlebell High Pull
kettlebell-high-pull.description: An explosive exercise that develops power in the hips, back, and shoulders. It involves pulling the kettlebell from a swing position (or floor) up towards chin height, keeping the elbow high.

kettlebell-figure-8.name: Kettlebell Figure 8
kettlebell-figure-8.description: A dynamic exercise that improves coordination, core stability, and grip strength by passing the kettlebell between and around the legs in a figure-eight motion.

kettlebell-suitcase-carry.name: Kettlebell Suitcase Carry
kettlebell-suitcase-carry.description: A unilateral loaded carry exercise that challenges core stability, grip strength, and posture by carrying a single heavy kettlebell in one hand, like a suitcase.

kettlebell-thruster.name: Kettlebell Thruster
kettlebell-thruster.description: A full-body compound exercise combining a kettlebell front squat with an overhead press in one fluid movement. Can be done with one or two kettlebells.

lat-pulldown-machine.name: Lat Pulldown (Machine)
lat-pulldown-machine.description: A machine-based exercise targeting the latissimus dorsi muscles by pulling a bar down towards the chest.

seated-row-machine.name: Seated Row (Machine)
seated-row-machine.description: A machine exercise for back thickness, targeting the middle back muscles by pulling handles towards the torso.

leg-press-machine.name: Leg Press (Machine)
leg-press-machine.description: A compound lower body exercise performed on a machine, pushing a weighted platform away with the legs.

leg-extension-machine.name: Leg Extension (Machine)
leg-extension-machine.description: An isolation exercise for the quadriceps, extending the lower legs against resistance.

leg-curl-machine.name: Leg Curl (Machine - Lying or Seated)
leg-curl-machine.description: An isolation exercise for the hamstrings, curling the lower legs towards the glutes against resistance.

chest-press-machine.name: Chest Press (Machine)
chest-press-machine.description: A machine-based compound exercise for the chest, similar to a bench press but with a fixed movement path.

shoulder-press-machine.name: Shoulder Press (Machine)
shoulder-press-machine.description: A machine exercise for the shoulders, pressing handles overhead with a guided motion.

pec-deck-fly-machine.name: Pec Deck Fly (Machine)
pec-deck-fly-machine.description: An isolation exercise for the chest, bringing arms together in a fly motion using a machine.

reverse-pec-deck-machine.name: Reverse Pec Deck (Rear Delt Fly)
reverse-pec-deck-machine.description: A machine exercise targeting the posterior deltoids (rear shoulders) and upper back muscles.

calf-raise-machine.name: Calf Raise (Machine - Standing or Seated)
calf-raise-machine.description: An isolation exercise for the calf muscles (gastrocnemius and soleus).

cable-tricep-pushdown.name: Cable Tricep Pushdown (Rope or Bar)
cable-tricep-pushdown.description: An isolation exercise for the triceps using a cable machine with a rope or bar attachment.

cable-bicep-curl.name: Cable Bicep Curl (Bar or Handles)
cable-bicep-curl.description: An isolation exercise for biceps using a cable machine, providing constant tension.

cable-face-pull.name: Cable Face Pull
cable-face-pull.description: An excellent exercise for rear deltoids, rotator cuff health, and upper back posture.

cable-fly.name: Cable Fly (Standing - High, Mid, or Low)
cable-fly.description: An isolation exercise for the chest using a cable machine, allowing for various angles to target different parts of the chest.

cable-lateral-raise.name: Cable Lateral Raise
cable-lateral-raise.description: An isolation exercise for the medial deltoids using a cable, providing constant tension throughout the movement.

cable-woodchop.name: Cable Woodchop (High to Low or Low to High)
cable-woodchop.description: A core rotational exercise engaging the obliques and transverse abdominis.

resistance-band-bicep-curl.name: Resistance Band Bicep Curl
resistance-band-bicep-curl.description: Bicep curls performed with a resistance band, providing variable resistance.

resistance-band-tricep-pushdown.name: Resistance Band Tricep Pushdown
resistance-band-tricep-pushdown.description: Tricep pushdowns using a resistance band anchored overhead or held.

resistance-band-pull-apart.name: Resistance Band Pull-Apart
resistance-band-pull-apart.description: A great exercise for shoulder health, targeting the rear deltoids and upper back muscles.

resistance-band-squat.name: Resistance Band Squat
resistance-band-squat.description: Squats performed with a resistance band underfoot and looped over shoulders or held, adding resistance.

resistance-band-glute-bridge.name: Resistance Band Glute Bridge
resistance-band-glute-bridge.description: Glute bridges with a resistance band around the thighs for added glute medius activation.

farmers-walk.name: Farmer's Walk
farmers-walk.description: A full-body exercise involving walking for a distance while holding heavy weights (dumbbells, kettlebells, or farmer's walk handles). Improves grip strength, core stability, and overall conditioning.

box-jump.name: Box Jump
box-jump.description: A plyometric exercise that involves jumping onto an elevated platform, developing explosive power in the lower body.

medicine-ball-slam.name: Medicine Ball Slam
medicine-ball-slam.description: A full-body power exercise involving lifting a medicine ball overhead and slamming it forcefully onto the ground.

glute-bridge.name: Glute Bridge
glute-bridge.description: A bodyweight exercise targeting the glutes and hamstrings by lifting the hips off the floor.

superman-exercise.name: Superman
superman-exercise.description: A bodyweight exercise that strengthens the lower back, glutes, and hamstrings by simultaneously lifting arms and legs off the floor while lying prone.

mountain-climbers.name: Mountain Climbers
mountain-climbers.description: A dynamic full-body exercise that builds cardio endurance, core strength, and agility, mimicking the motion of climbing a mountain.

bench-dips.name: Bench Dips (Triceps)
bench-dips.description: A bodyweight exercise targeting the triceps, performed using a bench or chair.

bodyweight-calf-raise.name: Bodyweight Calf Raise
bodyweight-calf-raise.description: A simple yet effective bodyweight exercise to strengthen the calf muscles.

barbell-hip-thrust.name: Barbell Hip Thrust
barbell-hip-thrust.description: A powerful glute exercise performed by thrusting the hips upward with a barbell across the lap, typically with the upper back supported on a bench.

barbell-front-squat.name: Barbell Front Squat
barbell-front-squat.description: A squat variation where the barbell is held across the front of the shoulders, emphasizing quads and core stability.

barbell-good-morning.name: Barbell Good Morning
barbell-good-morning.description: An exercise targeting the posterior chain (hamstrings, glutes, lower back) by hinging at the hips with a barbell on the upper back.

dumbbell-incline-press.name: Dumbbell Incline Press
dumbbell-incline-press.description: Targets the upper chest, shoulders, and triceps by pressing dumbbells on an incline bench.

dumbbell-fly.name: Dumbbell Fly
dumbbell-fly.description: An isolation exercise for the chest, performed by opening and closing the arms in an arc motion while holding dumbbells.

dumbbell-hammer-curl.name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl
dumbbell-hammer-curl.description: A bicep curl variation with a neutral grip (palms facing each other), targeting the brachialis and brachioradialis in addition to the biceps.

dumbbell-tricep-kickback.name: Dumbbell Tricep Kickback
dumbbell-tricep-kickback.description: An isolation exercise for the triceps, performed by extending the arm backward while hinged at the hips.

dumbbell-bulgarian-split-squat.name: Dumbbell Bulgarian Split Squat
dumbbell-bulgarian-split-squat.description: A unilateral leg exercise with the rear foot elevated, targeting quads, glutes, and hamstrings while improving balance.

dumbbell-pullover.name: Dumbbell Pullover
dumbbell-pullover.description: An exercise that works the chest and lats, performed by lying on a bench and lowering a dumbbell behind the head.

kettlebell-snatch.name: Kettlebell Snatch
kettlebell-snatch.description: An explosive full-body exercise where the kettlebell is swung from between the legs to an overhead locked-out position in one fluid motion.

kettlebell-halo.name: Kettlebell Halo
kettlebell-halo.description: A shoulder mobility and stability exercise involving circling a kettlebell around the head.

hack-squat-machine.name: Hack Squat (Machine)
hack-squat-machine.description: A machine-based squat variation that targets the quadriceps, often with a focus on the outer quads.

seated-calf-raise-machine.name: Seated Calf Raise (Machine)
seated-calf-raise-machine.description: An isolation exercise for the soleus muscle of the calf, performed on a seated machine.

abdominal-crunch-machine.name: Abdominal Crunch (Machine)
abdominal-crunch-machine.description: A machine-based exercise for isolating the rectus abdominis muscles.

back-extension-machine.name: Back Extension (Hyperextension Machine)
back-extension-machine.description: Strengthens the lower back, glutes, and hamstrings using a hyperextension bench or machine.

cable-overhead-tricep-extension.name: Cable Overhead Tricep Extension (Rope)
cable-overhead-tricep-extension.description: Targets the long head of the triceps using a cable machine and rope attachment.

cable-pull-through.name: Cable Pull-Through
cable-pull-through.description: A hip hinge exercise that targets the glutes and hamstrings using a cable machine.

cable-reverse-fly.name: Cable Reverse Fly
cable-reverse-fly.description: Targets the posterior deltoids and upper back muscles using a cable machine with dual pulleys.

cable-torso-twist.name: Cable Torso Twist (Standing)
cable-torso-twist.description: A core exercise targeting the obliques through rotational movement against cable resistance.

resistance-band-chest-press.name: Resistance Band Chest Press
resistance-band-chest-press.description: A chest press variation using resistance bands, can be done standing or lying down.

resistance-band-row.name: Resistance Band Row (Seated or Standing)
resistance-band-row.description: Targets back muscles using a resistance band, can be anchored or held.

resistance-band-deadlift.name: Resistance Band Deadlift
resistance-band-deadlift.description: A deadlift variation using resistance bands, good for learning form or lighter days.

resistance-band-lateral-walk.name: Resistance Band Lateral Walk (Crab Walk)
resistance-band-lateral-walk.description: Targets the glute medius and hip abductors, performed by walking sideways with a band around ankles or knees.

hamstring-stretch.name: Hamstring Stretch (Standing/Seated)
hamstring-stretch.description: A static stretch to improve flexibility in the hamstring muscles.

quadriceps-stretch.name: Quadriceps Stretch (Standing)
quadriceps-stretch.description: A static stretch for the quadriceps, typically performed by pulling the heel towards the glutes.

chest-stretch-doorway.name: Chest Stretch (Doorway)
chest-stretch-doorway.description: A static stretch for the pectoral muscles using a doorway for leverage.

triceps-stretch.name: Triceps Stretch (Overhead)
triceps-stretch.description: A static stretch for the triceps, performed by reaching one arm overhead and bending the elbow.

cat-cow-stretch.name: Cat-Cow Stretch
cat-cow-stretch.description: A dynamic stretch that improves spinal mobility and relieves tension in the back and core.

childs-pose.name: Child's Pose
childs-pose.description: A gentle resting pose that calms the brain and helps relieve stress and fatigue. It gently stretches the hips, thighs, and ankles.

jumping-jacks.name: Jumping Jacks
jumping-jacks.description: A classic full-body calisthenic exercise that serves as a good warm-up or cardio burst.

high-knees.name: High Knees
high-knees.description: A cardio-intensive exercise that involves running in place while lifting the knees as high as possible.

running-jogging.name: Running/Jogging
running-jogging.description: An effective cardiovascular exercise that improves endurance and burns calories.

cycling.name: Cycling
cycling.description: A low-impact cardiovascular exercise that primarily works the leg muscles.

jump-rope.name: Jump Rope
jump-rope.description: A highly effective cardiovascular exercise that improves coordination, agility, and burns a significant amount of calories.

elliptical-trainer.name: Elliptical Trainer
elliptical-trainer.description: A low-impact cardio machine that simulates stair climbing, walking, or running without causing excessive pressure to the joints.

stair-climbing.name: Stair Climbing
stair-climbing.description: A vigorous cardiovascular exercise that targets the glutes, quads, and hamstrings.

sled-push.name: Sled Push
sled-push.description: A full-body strength and conditioning exercise involving pushing a weighted sled.

sled-pull.name: Sled Pull
sled-pull.description: A full-body strength and conditioning exercise involving pulling a weighted sled using straps or a harness.

tire-flip.name: Tire Flip
tire-flip.description: A powerful full-body exercise common in strongman training, involving flipping a large tire.

battle-ropes.name: Battle Ropes
battle-ropes.description: A high-intensity, low-impact exercise that works the upper body, core, and provides a cardiovascular challenge.

alternating-proprioceptive-reverse-lunge.name: Alternating Proprioceptive Reverse Lunge
alternating-proprioceptive-reverse-lunge.description: A reverse lunge variation that challenges balance and body awareness by alternating legs with each repetition, often on an unstable surface or with eyes closed to enhance proprioception.

rehab-ankle-pumps.name: Ankle Pumps
rehab-ankle-pumps.description: A simple mobility exercise involving flexing and extending the ankles, often used to improve circulation and range of motion after injury or inactivity.

archer-push-up.name: Archer Push-up
archer-push-up.description: A unilateral push-up variation where one arm extends out to the side while the other performs the push-up, building strength and control one side at a time.

barbell-skull-crusher.name: Barbell Skull Crusher
barbell-skull-crusher.description: An isolation exercise for the triceps, performed by lying on a bench and lowering a barbell towards the forehead before extending the elbows.

bird-dog.name: Bird Dog
bird-dog.description: A core stability exercise where you simultaneously extend an opposite arm and leg while on all fours, improving balance and spinal stability.

rehab-bird-dog-stability.name: Bird-Dog (Stability Focus)
rehab-bird-dog-stability.description: A variation of the Bird Dog exercise emphasizing slow, controlled movements and holds to maximize core stabilization and control.

bulgarian-bag-arm-throw.name: Bulgarian Bag Arm Throw
bulgarian-bag-arm-throw.description: A dynamic rotational exercise using a Bulgarian Bag, involving swinging and throwing the bag across the body to develop core power and coordination.

bulgarian-bag-snatch.name: Bulgarian Bag Snatch
bulgarian-bag-snatch.description: An explosive full-body movement where a Bulgarian Bag is swung from between the legs to an overhead position in one fluid motion.

bulgarian-bag-spin.name: Bulgarian Bag Spin
bulgarian-bag-spin.description: A signature Bulgarian Bag exercise involving spinning the bag around the head and body, building shoulder stability, core strength, and grip.

bulgarian-bag-suplex.name: Bulgarian Bag Suplex
bulgarian-bag-suplex.description: A power-focused exercise that mimics a wrestling suplex, involving lifting and throwing the Bulgarian Bag over the shoulder.

burpee-box-jump.name: Burpee with Box Jump
burpee-box-jump.description: A high-intensity variation of the burpee where the final jump is performed onto an elevated box, increasing the plyometric demand.

cable-seated-row.name: Cable Seated Row
cable-seated-row.description: A machine exercise for back thickness, targeting the middle back muscles by pulling handles towards the torso from a seated position.

calf-stretch.name: Calf Stretch
calf-stretch.description: A flexibility exercise to lengthen the gastrocnemius and soleus muscles, typically performed against a wall or on a step.

chin-tucks-cervical-retraction.name: Chin Tucks (Cervical Retraction)
chin-tucks-cervical-retraction.description: A postural exercise to correct forward head posture by gently retracting the head and neck, strengthening the deep cervical flexors.

rehab-clamshells.name: Clamshells
rehab-clamshells.description: A hip abduction exercise performed lying on your side to strengthen the gluteus medius, crucial for hip stability.

clubbell-barbarian-squat.name: Clubbell Barbarian Squat
clubbell-barbarian-squat.description: A complex exercise combining a squat with rotational clubbell movements, challenging coordination, core strength, and lower body power.

clubbell-gamma-cast.name: Clubbell Gamma Cast
clubbell-gamma-cast.description: A foundational clubbell exercise involving a pendulum swing from side to side in front of the body, building grip, shoulder, and core strength.

clubbell-mill.name: Clubbell Mill
clubbell-mill.description: A circular strength exercise where a clubbell is swung in a rotational pattern around the body, similar to a windmill motion, improving shoulder mobility and stability.

clubbell-shield-cast.name: Clubbell Shield Cast
clubbell-shield-cast.description: A core clubbell movement where the club is cast over the shoulder in a protective 'shield' motion, great for shoulder and thoracic mobility.

crab-walk.name: Crab Walk
crab-walk.description: A bodyweight exercise performed by walking on hands and feet with the chest facing up, engaging the triceps, shoulders, glutes, and hamstrings.

dead-bug.name: Dead Bug
dead-bug.description: A core exercise where you lie on your back and slowly lower opposite arms and legs, improving lumbo-pelvic stability without stressing the back.

decline-push-up.name: Decline Push-up
decline-push-up.description: A push-up variation with the feet elevated, which increases the load on the upper chest and shoulders.

dolphin-plank.name: Dolphin Plank
dolphin-plank.description: An advanced plank variation performed on the forearms, involving piking the hips up and down to challenge the shoulders and core.

double-kettlebell-alternating-clean.name: Double Kettlebell Alternating Clean
double-kettlebell-alternating-clean.description: An exercise holding two kettlebells, where you alternate cleaning each one to the rack position, challenging coordination and core stability.

double-kettlebell-alternating-floor-pres.name: Double Kettlebell Alternating Floor Press
double-kettlebell-alternating-floor-pres.description: A floor press using two kettlebells, where you press one arm at a time, forcing the core to resist rotation.

double-kettlebell-alternating-rotational.name: Double Kettlebell Alternating Rotational Press
double-kettlebell-alternating-rotational.description: An overhead press with two kettlebells, incorporating a torso rotation as you press each bell up one at a time.

double-kettlebell-alternating-snatch.name: Double Kettlebell Alternating Snatch
double-kettlebell-alternating-snatch.description: An explosive exercise where you alternate snatching each kettlebell overhead in a continuous, fluid motion.

double-kettlebell-arching-swing.name: Double Kettlebell Arching Swing
double-kettlebell-arching-swing.description: A swing variation where two kettlebells are swung in an arching, outside-the-legs path, challenging the hips and core differently than a standard swing.

double-kettlebell-bent-over-row.name: Double Kettlebell Bent-Over Row
double-kettlebell-bent-over-row.description: A strength exercise for the back, performing a bent-over row while holding a kettlebell in each hand.

double-kettlebell-clean.name: Double Kettlebell Clean
double-kettlebell-clean.description: A power exercise where two kettlebells are simultaneously cleaned from a swing position to the rack position on the chest.

double-kettlebell-clean-and-jerk.name: Double Kettlebell Clean and Jerk
double-kettlebell-clean-and-jerk.description: A full-body ballistic lift combining the double kettlebell clean with a powerful jerk to drive both bells overhead.

double-kettlebell-clean-and-push-press.name: Double Kettlebell Clean and Push Press
double-kettlebell-clean-and-push-press.description: A compound movement combining the double kettlebell clean with a push press, using leg drive to help press the bells overhead.

double-kettlebell-clean-to-reverse-lunge.name: Double Kettlebell Clean to Reverse Lunge
double-kettlebell-clean-to-reverse-lunge.description: A complex that combines a double kettlebell clean with a reverse lunge on each leg before repeating.

double-kettlebell-complex-clean-squat-pr.name: Double Kettlebell Complex (Clean-Squat-Press)
double-kettlebell-complex-clean-squat-pr.description: A sequence where you perform a double kettlebell clean, followed by a front squat, and then an overhead press in one continuous complex.

double-kettlebell-deadlift-to-swing.name: Double Kettlebell Deadlift to Swing
double-kettlebell-deadlift-to-swing.description: An exercise that begins with a double kettlebell deadlift and flows directly into a kettlebell swing, helping to pattern the hip hinge.

double-kettlebell-farmers-squat.name: Double Kettlebell Farmer's Squat
double-kettlebell-farmers-squat.description: A squat variation performed while holding two kettlebells at your sides (farmer's carry position), heavily engaging the traps and core.

double-kettlebell-floor-press.name: Double Kettlebell Floor Press
double-kettlebell-floor-press.description: A chest and triceps exercise performed by lying on the floor and pressing two kettlebells upward. The floor limits range of motion, focusing on lockout strength.

double-kettlebell-front-squat.name: Double Kettlebell Front Squat
double-kettlebell-front-squat.description: A squat performed while holding two kettlebells in the front rack position, intensely challenging the quads, glutes, and core.

double-kettlebell-front-squat-to-press-o.name: Double Kettlebell Front Squat to Press-Out
double-kettlebell-front-squat-to-press-o.description: Combines a double kettlebell front squat with an isometric press-out at the bottom of the squat, increasing core and shoulder engagement.

double-kettlebell-gorilla-row.name: Double Kettlebell Gorilla Row
double-kettlebell-gorilla-row.description: An alternating row performed from a deep hip hinge position with two kettlebells on the floor, building back strength and stability.

double-kettlebell-offset-carry-overhead-.name: Double Kettlebell Offset Carry (Overhead/Rack)
double-kettlebell-offset-carry-overhead-.description: A loaded carry where one kettlebell is held overhead and the other is in the rack position, creating a significant challenge for core and shoulder stability.

double-kettlebell-offset-squat-rack-suit.name: Double Kettlebell Offset Squat (Rack/Suitcase)
double-kettlebell-offset-squat-rack-suit.description: A squat performed while holding one kettlebell in the rack position and the other in the suitcase position (at your side), challenging anti-lateral flexion.

double-kettlebell-overhead-carry.name: Double Kettlebell Overhead Carry
double-kettlebell-overhead-carry.description: A loaded carry that involves walking while holding two kettlebells locked out overhead, building immense shoulder and core stability.

double-kettlebell-overhead-lunge.name: Double Kettlebell Overhead Lunge
double-kettlebell-overhead-lunge.description: A lunge performed while holding two kettlebells overhead, demanding significant full-body stability and strength.

double-kettlebell-press.name: Double Kettlebell Overhead Press
double-kettlebell-press.description: A shoulder strength exercise involving pressing two kettlebells from the rack position to overhead.

double-kettlebell-push-press.name: Double Kettlebell Push Press
double-kettlebell-push-press.description: An explosive overhead press that uses a dip and drive from the legs to help propel two kettlebells overhead.

double-kettlebell-push-up-to-renegade-ro.name: Double Kettlebell Push-up to Renegade Row
double-kettlebell-push-up-to-renegade-ro.description: A complex involving a push-up on two kettlebells, followed by rowing each kettlebell to the chest one at a time.

double-kettlebell-rack-deadlift.name: Double Kettlebell Rack Deadlift
double-kettlebell-rack-deadlift.description: A deadlift variation where the kettlebells are held in the front rack position, placing a heavy emphasis on the quads and core.

double-kettlebell-renegade-row.name: Double Kettlebell Renegade Row
double-kettlebell-renegade-row.description: From a plank position on two kettlebells, you alternate rowing each bell to your chest, challenging core stability and back strength.

double-kettlebell-rotational-press.name: Double Kettlebell Rotational Press
double-kettlebell-rotational-press.description: An overhead press that incorporates a pivot and rotation of the torso to generate power.

double-kettlebell-see-saw-press.name: Double Kettlebell See-Saw Press
double-kettlebell-see-saw-press.description: An alternating overhead press where as one kettlebell goes up, the other comes down, creating constant tension and a stability challenge.

double-kettlebell-see-saw-row.name: Double Kettlebell See-Saw Row
double-kettlebell-see-saw-row.description: An alternating bent-over row where as one kettlebell is rowed up, the other is lowered, challenging the back and core.

double-kettlebell-snatch.name: Double Kettlebell Snatch
double-kettlebell-snatch.description: A highly athletic movement where two kettlebells are swung and punched into an overhead lockout in one explosive motion.

double-kettlebell-split-jerk.name: Double Kettlebell Split Jerk
double-kettlebell-split-jerk.description: A powerful jerk variation where you dip, drive, and drop under the kettlebells into a split stance to receive them overhead.

double-kettlebell-split-snatch.name: Double Kettlebell Split Snatch
double-kettlebell-split-snatch.description: An advanced snatch variation where you catch the two kettlebells overhead by moving your feet into a split stance.

double-kettlebell-suitcase-deadlift.name: Double Kettlebell Suitcase Deadlift
double-kettlebell-suitcase-deadlift.description: A deadlift performed with a kettlebell on the outside of each foot, challenging the legs, back, and core stability.

double-kettlebell-sumo-deadlift.name: Double Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift
double-kettlebell-sumo-deadlift.description: A deadlift performed with a wide (sumo) stance, holding two kettlebells between the legs, emphasizing the glutes and hips.

double-kettlebell-thruster.name: Double Kettlebell Thruster
double-kettlebell-thruster.description: A full-body compound exercise combining a double kettlebell front squat with an overhead press in one fluid movement.

double-kettlebell-walking-lunge.name: Double Kettlebell Walking Lunge
double-kettlebell-walking-lunge.description: Walking lunges performed while holding two kettlebells, typically in the rack or farmer's position, to add significant load.

double-kettlebell-windmill.name: Double Kettlebell Windmill
double-kettlebell-windmill.description: An advanced windmill variation where you hold one kettlebell overhead and hinge to pick up a second from the floor, requiring immense stability and mobility.

dumbbell-arnold-press.name: Dumbbell Arnold Press
dumbbell-arnold-press.description: A shoulder press variation that incorporates rotation to work all three heads of the deltoid.

dumbbell-concentration-curl.name: Dumbbell Concentration Curl
dumbbell-concentration-curl.description: A seated bicep curl where the elbow is braced against the inner thigh to isolate the bicep muscle.

dumbbell-incline-bench-press.name: Dumbbell Incline Bench Press
dumbbell-incline-bench-press.description: Targets the upper chest, shoulders, and triceps by pressing dumbbells on an incline bench.

dumbbell-incline-fly.name: Dumbbell Incline Fly
dumbbell-incline-fly.description: An isolation exercise for the upper chest performed on an incline bench, opening and closing the arms in a wide arc.

dumbbell-overhead-lunge.name: Dumbbell Overhead Lunge
dumbbell-overhead-lunge.description: A lunge performed while holding one or two dumbbells overhead, challenging balance, shoulder stability, and core strength.

dumbbell-pistol-squat-double.name: Dumbbell Pistol Squat (Double)
dumbbell-pistol-squat-double.description: A single-leg squat performed while holding two dumbbells, typically at the shoulders or sides, adding significant load to the movement.

dumbbell-pistol-squat-single.name: Dumbbell Pistol Squat (Single)
dumbbell-pistol-squat-single.description: A single-leg squat performed while holding one dumbbell, often in the goblet position, to act as a counterbalance and add resistance.

dumbbell-row-to-deadlift-complex.name: Dumbbell Row to Deadlift Complex
dumbbell-row-to-deadlift-complex.description: A sequence combining a dumbbell Romanian deadlift with a bent-over row in each repetition.

dumbbell-tate-press.name: Dumbbell Tate Press
dumbbell-tate-press.description: A triceps exercise performed lying on a bench, where dumbbells are lowered towards the chest with elbows flared out, and then pressed back up.

explosive-clap-push-up.name: Explosive Clap Push-up
explosive-clap-push-up.description: A plyometric push-up where you explosively push off the floor with enough force to clap your hands in mid-air.

frog-stand.name: Frog Stand
frog-stand.description: A foundational arm balance in gymnastics and yoga, where you balance your knees on your elbows in a tucked position.

front-lever.name: Front Lever
front-lever.description: An advanced gymnastics move where the body is held parallel to the ground, face up, while hanging from a bar, requiring immense back and core strength.

glute-squeezes-isometric.name: Glute Squeezes (Isometric)
glute-squeezes-isometric.description: A simple activation exercise involving consciously squeezing and holding the gluteal muscles, often done as part of a warm-up.

half-turkish-get-up.name: Half Turkish Get-Up
half-turkish-get-up.description: The first portion of the full Turkish Get-Up, moving from a lying position to a seated position with the weight overhead. Excellent for core and shoulder stability.

handstand.name: Handstand
handstand.description: The act of supporting the body in a stable, inverted vertical position by balancing on the hands.

handstand-push-up.name: Handstand Push-up
handstand-push-up.description: An advanced pressing exercise performed from a handstand position, targeting the shoulders and triceps.

heel-slides.name: Heel Slides
heel-slides.description: A gentle rehabilitation exercise for knee flexion, performed by sliding the heel towards and away from the body while seated or lying down.

hip-flexor-stretch.name: Hip Flexor Stretch
hip-flexor-stretch.description: A stretch targeting the muscles at the front of the hip, commonly performed in a half-kneeling position.

incline-chest-press-machine.name: Incline Chest Press (Machine)
incline-chest-press-machine.description: A machine-based exercise that targets the upper pectoral muscles with a guided, upward pressing motion.

indian-club-double-circles.name: Indian Club Double Circles
indian-club-double-circles.description: A coordination and mobility drill using two Indian clubs, swung in circular patterns to improve shoulder health and range of motion.

indian-club-heart-shapes.name: Indian Club Heart Shapes
indian-club-heart-shapes.description: A rhythmic Indian club exercise where the clubs are swung in a pattern resembling a heart, promoting shoulder mobility and coordination.

inverted-row.name: Inverted Row
inverted-row.description: A bodyweight back exercise where you hang underneath a bar and pull your chest up to it, often considered a precursor to the pull-up.

jump-squat.name: Jump Squat
jump-squat.description: A plyometric exercise combining a squat with a vertical jump to develop lower body power and explosiveness.

kettlebell-360-mace-style.name: Kettlebell 360 (Mace Style)
kettlebell-360-mace-style.description: A rotational exercise mimicking a steel mace 360, where a kettlebell is swung around the head to build shoulder and core strength.

kettlebell-arm-bar.name: Kettlebell Arm Bar
kettlebell-arm-bar.description: A shoulder stability and mobility exercise, where you lie on your side while balancing a kettlebell overhead with a straight arm.

kettlebell-bent-press.name: Kettlebell Bent Press
kettlebell-bent-press.description: A classic strongman lift involving pressing a kettlebell overhead while bending sideways, leveraging core and back strength.

kettlebell-bicep-curl.name: Kettlebell Bicep Curl
kettlebell-bicep-curl.description: An isolation exercise for the biceps performed by curling a kettlebell. Can be done with a standard or crush grip.

kettlebell-bottoms-up-carry.name: Kettlebell Bottoms-Up Carry
kettlebell-bottoms-up-carry.description: A loaded carry where the kettlebell is held upside down, challenging grip, rotator cuff, and core stability.

kettlebell-bottoms-up-clean.name: Kettlebell Bottoms-Up Clean
kettlebell-bottoms-up-clean.description: Cleaning a kettlebell to the rack position but finishing with it balanced upside down, demanding incredible tension and control.

kettlebell-bottoms-up-press.name: Kettlebell Bottoms-Up Press
kettlebell-bottoms-up-press.description: A strict press performed with the kettlebell held upside down, excellent for building shoulder stability and pressing mechanics.

kettlebell-cheat-row.name: Kettlebell Cheat Row
kettlebell-cheat-row.description: A heavy bent-over row that uses slight body english or momentum to lift a heavier weight than possible with strict form.

kettlebell-clean-and-jerk-single-arm.name: Kettlebell Clean And Jerk (Single Arm)
kettlebell-clean-and-jerk-single-arm.description: The classic kettlebell lift, involving cleaning the bell to the rack and then driving it overhead with a powerful jerk.

kettlebell-clean-ohp-complex.name: Kettlebell Clean & OHP Complex
kettlebell-clean-ohp-complex.description: A complex that combines a single-arm kettlebell clean directly into an overhead press for each repetition.

kettlebell-close-grip-floor-press.name: Kettlebell Close Grip Floor Press
kettlebell-close-grip-floor-press.description: A floor press variation performed by holding a single kettlebell with both hands in a close grip, targeting the triceps and inner chest.

kettlebell-cossack-squat.name: Kettlebell Cossack Squat
kettlebell-cossack-squat.description: A lateral squat that builds hip mobility and single-leg strength, performed by squatting down to one side while holding a kettlebell, often in the goblet position.

kettlebell-crush-grip-curl.name: Kettlebell Crush Grip Curl
kettlebell-crush-grip-curl.description: A bicep curl where the kettlebell is held by the bell ('crushing' it between the hands) to increase isometric tension in the chest and arms.

kettlebell-crush-grip-floor-press.name: Kettlebell Crush Grip Floor Press
kettlebell-crush-grip-floor-press.description: A floor press performed by holding a kettlebell by the bell with both hands, focusing on the chest and triceps.

kettlebell-curtsy-lunge.name: Kettlebell Curtsy Lunge
kettlebell-curtsy-lunge.description: A lunge variation where the rear leg crosses behind the front leg, targeting the gluteus medius and inner thighs, often performed holding a kettlebell.

kettlebell-dead-bug-pullover.name: Kettlebell Dead Bug Pullover
kettlebell-dead-bug-pullover.description: A core exercise combining the dead bug movement with a kettlebell pullover, challenging coordination and stability.

kettlebell-dead-clean.name: Kettlebell Dead Clean
kettlebell-dead-clean.description: A kettlebell clean initiated from a dead stop on the floor for each repetition, building explosive power from the ground up.

kettlebell-dead-swing.name: Kettlebell Dead Swing
kettlebell-dead-swing.description: A kettlebell swing where each repetition starts from a dead stop on the floor, focusing on generating maximum power for each swing.

kettlebell-deadstop-swing.name: Kettlebell Deadstop Swing
kettlebell-deadstop-swing.description: Also known as the Dead Swing, this variation starts each repetition from the floor to build explosive hip drive without the benefit of momentum.

kettlebell-deck-front-roll.name: Kettlebell Deck Front Roll
kettlebell-deck-front-roll.description: A dynamic movement combining a backward roll into a deck squat, using the kettlebell as a counterweight to stand up and transition into a forward roll.

kettlebell-deck-squat.name: Kettlebell Deck Squat
kettlebell-deck-squat.description: An exercise where you perform a squat, roll onto your back, and then use momentum and the kettlebell's weight to roll back up to a standing position.

kettlebell-double-farmers-walk.name: Kettlebell Double Farmer's Walk
kettlebell-double-farmers-walk.description: A full-body exercise where you walk for distance while holding a heavy kettlebell in each hand.

kettlebell-double-hand-deadlift.name: Kettlebell Double Hand Deadlift
kettlebell-double-hand-deadlift.description: A deadlift using a single kettlebell held with both hands, excellent for learning the hip hinge pattern.

kettlebell-double-hand-swing.name: Kettlebell Double Hand Swing
kettlebell-double-hand-swing.description: The foundational kettlebell swing, performed by holding one kettlebell with both hands.

kettlebell-double-overhead-squat.name: Kettlebell Double Overhead Squat
kettlebell-double-overhead-squat.description: An advanced squat variation requiring significant mobility and stability, performed while holding two kettlebells locked out overhead.

kettlebell-double-shrug.name: Kettlebell Double Shrug
kettlebell-double-shrug.description: A trapezius-strengthening exercise performed by shrugging the shoulders while holding a heavy kettlebell in each hand.

kettlebell-figure-eight-to-hold.name: Kettlebell Figure Eight to a Hold
kettlebell-figure-eight-to-hold.description: A variation of the kettlebell figure eight where the movement is paused and held at the front, challenging core and grip isometrically.

kettlebell-floor-skullcrusher.name: Kettlebell Floor Skullcrusher
kettlebell-floor-skullcrusher.description: A triceps extension exercise performed lying on the floor, lowering one or two kettlebells towards the head.

kettlebell-get-up-sit-up.name: Kettlebell Get-Up Sit-Up
kettlebell-get-up-sit-up.description: The initial sit-up phase of a Turkish Get-Up, excellent for building core strength and stability with the weight overhead.

kettlebell-glute-bridge-with-floor-press.name: Kettlebell Glute Bridge with Floor Press
kettlebell-glute-bridge-with-floor-press.description: A combination exercise where you hold a glute bridge while performing an alternating or double kettlebell floor press.

kettlebell-goblet-alternating-reverse-lu.name: Kettlebell Goblet Alternating Reverse Lunge
kettlebell-goblet-alternating-reverse-lu.description: Reverse lunges performed while holding a kettlebell in the goblet position, alternating legs with each repetition.

kettlebell-goblet-clean.name: Kettlebell Goblet Clean
kettlebell-goblet-clean.description: A clean variation where the kettlebell is cleaned into the goblet squat position, held with two hands at chest level.

kettlebell-goblet-squat-with-curl.name: Kettlebell Goblet Squat with Curl
kettlebell-goblet-squat-with-curl.description: A complex where a goblet squat is combined with a bicep curl at the top of the movement.

kettlebell-goblet-walk.name: Kettlebell Goblet Walk
kettlebell-goblet-walk.description: A loaded carry where you walk while holding a kettlebell in the goblet position, building core stability and upper body endurance.

kettlebell-good-morning-squat.name: Kettlebell Good Morning Squat
kettlebell-good-morning-squat.description: A hybrid exercise that starts with a good morning (hip hinge) and then transitions into a deep squat, often holding the kettlebell in the goblet position.

kettlebell-gorilla-clean.name: Kettlebell Gorilla Clean
kettlebell-gorilla-clean.description: An explosive clean performed from a deep squat/hinge position, often done with two kettlebells and in an alternating fashion.

kettlebell-half-kneeling-halo.name: Kettlebell Half-Kneeling Halo
kettlebell-half-kneeling-halo.description: A kettlebell halo performed from a half-kneeling stance to increase the core stability challenge and isolate the shoulder girdle.

kettlebell-half-kneeling-press.name: Kettlebell Half-Kneeling Press
kettlebell-half-kneeling-press.description: An overhead press performed from a half-kneeling position to challenge core stability and prevent using leg drive.

kettlebell-halifax.name: Kettlebell Halifax
kettlebell-halifax.description: A complex kettlebell flow that typically combines a clean, a squat, and a rotational press.

kettlebell-hang-clean.name: Kettlebell Hang Clean
kettlebell-hang-clean.description: A kettlebell clean that is initiated from a 'hang' position (after the first swing) rather than from a dead stop on the floor.

kettlebell-jefferson-curl.name: Kettlebell Jefferson Curl
kettlebell-jefferson-curl.description: A loaded spinal flexion stretch using a kettlebell to improve posterior chain flexibility and spinal mobility.

kettlebell-lateral-lunge.name: Kettlebell Lateral Lunge
kettlebell-lateral-lunge.description: A lunge to the side while holding a kettlebell (often in goblet or rack position) to target the inner and outer thighs and improve hip mobility.

kettlebell-lunge-pass-through.name: Kettlebell Lunge Pass-Through
kettlebell-lunge-pass-through.description: A lunge variation that includes passing the kettlebell under the front leg, challenging coordination and core stability.

kettlebell-lying-triceps-extension.name: Kettlebell Lying Triceps Extension
kettlebell-lying-triceps-extension.description: A triceps isolation exercise performed by lying on a bench or floor and extending one or two kettlebells from behind the head.

kettlebell-outside-swing.name: Kettlebell Outside Swing
kettlebell-outside-swing.description: A swing variation where the kettlebell travels outside the leg instead of between the legs.

kettlebell-pistol-squat-double.name: Kettlebell Pistol Squat (Double)
kettlebell-pistol-squat-double.description: An advanced single-leg squat performed while holding two kettlebells in the front rack position.

kettlebell-pistol-squat-single.name: Kettlebell Pistol Squat (Single)
kettlebell-pistol-squat-single.description: A single-leg squat performed while holding one kettlebell in the goblet position to act as a counterbalance.

kettlebell-plank-drag-pull-through.name: Kettlebell Plank Drag (Pull Through)
kettlebell-plank-drag-pull-through.description: An anti-rotation core exercise where you hold a plank and drag a kettlebell from one side of your body to the other.

kettlebell-pullover-to-sit-up-to-press.name: Kettlebell Pullover to Sit-up to Press
kettlebell-pullover-to-sit-up-to-press.description: A complex movement combining a pullover, a sit-up, and an overhead press in one fluid sequence.

kettlebell-rack-carry.name: Kettlebell Rack Carry
kettlebell-rack-carry.description: A loaded carry where you walk while holding one or two kettlebells in the front rack position, building core and upper back strength.

kettlebell-rack-walk.name: Kettlebell Rack Walk
kettlebell-rack-walk.description: Another name for the Kettlebell Rack Carry, emphasizing walking for distance or time.

kettlebell-rotational-deadlift.name: Kettlebell Rotational Deadlift
kettlebell-rotational-deadlift.description: A deadlift variation that incorporates a rotation of the torso to pick up a kettlebell positioned to the side of the body.

kettlebell-rotational-swing.name: Kettlebell Rotational Swing
kettlebell-rotational-swing.description: A kettlebell swing with a rotational component, where the hips and torso pivot during the movement.

kettlebell-row-to-deadlift-complex.name: Kettlebell Row to Deadlift Complex
kettlebell-row-to-deadlift-complex.description: A sequence involving a kettlebell deadlift followed immediately by a bent-over row.

kettlebell-side-press.name: Kettlebell Side Press
kettlebell-side-press.description: A classic pressing variation where you lean away from the kettlebell to gain a mechanical advantage to press it overhead.

kettlebell-single-arm-clean-and-thruster.name: Kettlebell Single Arm Clean & Thruster
kettlebell-single-arm-clean-and-thruster.description: A complex combining a single-arm clean, a squat, and an overhead press in one powerful, fluid movement.

kettlebell-single-arm-complex-clean-squa.name: Kettlebell Single Arm Complex (Clean-Squat-Press)
kettlebell-single-arm-complex-clean-squa.description: A sequence of a single-arm clean, a squat, and an overhead press performed without setting the kettlebell down.

kettlebell-single-arm-deadlift.name: Kettlebell Single Arm Deadlift
kettlebell-single-arm-deadlift.description: A deadlift performed by lifting a single kettlebell with one arm, challenging anti-rotation and grip strength.

kettlebell-single-arm-overhead-squat.name: Kettlebell Single Arm Overhead Squat
kettlebell-single-arm-overhead-squat.description: A squat performed while holding a single kettlebell locked out overhead, demanding exceptional mobility and stability.

kettlebell-single-arm-shrug.name: Kettlebell Single Arm Shrug
kettlebell-single-arm-shrug.description: A unilateral shrug performed with a heavy kettlebell to target the trapezius muscle on one side.

kettlebell-single-arm-thruster.name: Kettlebell Single Arm Thruster
kettlebell-single-arm-thruster.description: A compound exercise combining a single-arm racked squat with an overhead press.

kettlebell-single-leg-deadlift.name: Kettlebell Single Leg Deadlift
kettlebell-single-leg-deadlift.description: A unilateral hinge movement that challenges balance, stability, and posterior chain strength, performed while holding a kettlebell.

kettlebell-slingshot.name: Kettlebell Slingshot
kettlebell-slingshot.description: A warm-up and coordination drill that involves passing a kettlebell around the body from hand to hand.

kettlebell-slingshot-to-goblet-squat.name: Kettlebell Slingshot to Goblet Squat
kettlebell-slingshot-to-goblet-squat.description: A flow that combines the kettlebell slingshot with a goblet squat in each repetition.

kettlebell-snatch-to-overhead-reverse-lu.name: Kettlebell Snatch to Overhead Reverse Lunge
kettlebell-snatch-to-overhead-reverse-lu.description: A complex where you perform a kettlebell snatch and then execute a reverse lunge while keeping the kettlebell stable overhead.

kettlebell-snatch-to-reverse-lunge.name: Kettlebell Snatch to Reverse Lunge
kettlebell-snatch-to-reverse-lunge.description: A complex combining a kettlebell snatch with a reverse lunge. The lunge can be done with the bell racked or held overhead.

kettlebell-somersault-squat.name: Kettlebell Somersault Squat
kettlebell-somersault-squat.description: An advanced squat variation involving rolling the kettlebell over the shoulder during the squat, challenging mobility and coordination.

kettlebell-sots-press.name: Kettlebell Sot's Press
kettlebell-sots-press.description: An overhead press performed from the bottom of a deep squat, requiring incredible mobility, stability, and strength.

kettlebell-sport-style-swing.name: Kettlebell Sport Style Swing
kettlebell-sport-style-swing.description: A more efficient, pendulum-like swing used in Kettlebell Sport (Girevoy) competitions, designed for endurance over maximum power.

kettlebell-stacked-stance-deadlift.name: Kettlebell Stacked Stance Deadlift
kettlebell-stacked-stance-deadlift.description: A deadlift variation with a staggered stance (one foot slightly behind the other) to increase the load on the front leg.

kettlebell-standing-pullover.name: Kettlebell Standing Pullover
kettlebell-standing-pullover.description: A mobility and strength exercise for the lats and serratus, performed by lowering a kettlebell behind the head while standing.

kettlebell-straight-leg-sit-up.name: Kettlebell Straight-Leg Sit-up
kettlebell-straight-leg-sit-up.description: A weighted sit-up performed with straight legs while holding a kettlebell at the chest or overhead.

kettlebell-suitcase-farmers-carry.name: Kettlebell Suitcase/Farmer's Carry
kettlebell-suitcase-farmers-carry.description: A loaded carry performed with a kettlebell in one hand (suitcase) or both hands (farmer's), building grip, core, and posture.

kettlebell-sumo-deadlift-high-pull.name: Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pull
kettlebell-sumo-deadlift-high-pull.description: An explosive movement combining a sumo deadlift with a powerful upright row, developing full-body power.

kettlebell-swing-to-snatch.name: Kettlebell Swing to Snatch
kettlebell-swing-to-snatch.description: A drill that helps learn the snatch by breaking it down into a swing followed by the upward punch to lockout.

kettlebell-tactical-lunge.name: Kettlebell Tactical Lunge
kettlebell-tactical-lunge.description: A lunge variation that often includes a pass-through or other coordinated movement, emphasizing athleticism and control.

kettlebell-tall-kneeling-press.name: Kettlebell Tall Kneeling Press
kettlebell-tall-kneeling-press.description: An overhead press performed while kneeling on both knees, which engages the glutes and core to create a stable base.

kettlebell-tate-press.name: Kettlebell Tate Press
kettlebell-tate-press.description: A triceps press where the kettlebells are lowered towards the chest with elbows flared, similar to the dumbbell version.

kettlebell-towel-curl.name: Kettlebell Towel Curl
kettlebell-towel-curl.description: A bicep curl using a towel threaded through the kettlebell handle to challenge grip strength.

kettlebell-turkish-sit-up.name: Kettlebell Turkish Sit-up
kettlebell-turkish-sit-up.description: The sit-up portion of the Turkish Get-Up, a powerful core and hip flexor exercise.

kettlebell-two-hand-bottoms-up-squat.name: Kettlebell Two-Hand Bottoms-Up Squat
kettlebell-two-hand-bottoms-up-squat.description: A squat performed while balancing a kettlebell upside down with two hands, requiring immense full-body tension.

kettlebell-upright-row.name: Kettlebell Upright Row
kettlebell-upright-row.description: An exercise that targets the shoulders and traps by pulling one or two kettlebells upward towards the chin.

kettlebell-waiters-walk.name: Kettlebell Waiter's Walk
kettlebell-waiters-walk.description: A unilateral loaded carry holding a kettlebell straight overhead, as if carrying a tray. Builds shoulder and core stability.

l-sit.name: L-Sit
l-sit.description: A gymnastic exercise where the body is held in a shape like the letter 'L', supporting oneself with the hands while legs are held straight out. Requires significant core and tricep strength.

leg-raises.name: Leg Raises
leg-raises.description: A core exercise targeting the lower abdominals, performed by lying on the back and raising the legs towards the ceiling.

lower-trunk-rotations-supine.name: Lower Trunk Rotations (Supine)
lower-trunk-rotations-supine.description: A gentle mobility exercise for the lower back, performed by lying on the back with knees bent and rotating the legs from side to side.

lying-leg-curl-machine.name: Lying Leg Curl (Machine)
lying-leg-curl-machine.description: An isolation exercise for the hamstrings performed on a machine while lying face down.

macebell-10-to-2.name: Macebell 10-to-2
macebell-10-to-2.description: A foundational macebell exercise involving a pendulum swing from side to side in front of the body, similar to a clock's hands moving from 10 to 2.

macebell-360.name: Macebell 360
macebell-360.description: The signature macebell exercise, involving swinging the mace in a full circle around the head, building grip, shoulder, and core strength.

macebell-gravedigger.name: Macebell Gravedigger
macebell-gravedigger.description: A rotational exercise that mimics the motion of digging with a shovel, targeting the core and improving rotational power.

macebell-spear-stab.name: Macebell Spear Stab
macebell-spear-stab.description: A full-body exercise that mimics stabbing with a spear, involving a powerful forward thrust of the mace.

machine-chest-press.name: Machine Chest Press
machine-chest-press.description: A compound exercise for the chest, similar to a bench press but with a fixed movement path provided by a machine.

machine-hip-abduction.name: Machine Hip Abduction
machine-hip-abduction.description: A machine-based isolation exercise for the outer thighs and gluteus medius by pushing the legs apart against resistance.

machine-hip-adduction.name: Machine Hip Adduction
machine-hip-adduction.description: A machine-based isolation exercise for the inner thighs by squeezing the legs together against resistance.

machine-lateral-raise.name: Machine Lateral Raise
machine-lateral-raise.description: An isolation exercise for the medial deltoids using a machine that provides a fixed path for the lateral raise motion.

military-press-barbell.name: Military Press (Barbell)
military-press-barbell.description: A strict overhead press with a barbell, performed standing, with no leg drive. It is a fundamental test of shoulder strength.

muscle-up.name: Muscle-up
muscle-up.description: An advanced gymnastics skill combining a pull-up with a dip in one fluid motion to transition from hanging below a bar or rings to being supported above them.

parallette-deep-push-up.name: Parallette Deep Push-up
parallette-deep-push-up.description: A push-up performed on parallettes, allowing for an increased range of motion and a deeper stretch in the chest.

parallette-l-sit.name: Parallette L-Sit
parallette-l-sit.description: An L-Sit performed on parallettes, which can be slightly easier than on the floor as it provides more clearance for the legs.

parallette-shoot-through.name: Parallette Shoot-Through
parallette-shoot-through.description: A dynamic gymnastic movement on parallettes, transitioning from a plank or push-up position to a tuck or L-sit by 'shooting' the legs through the arms.

parallette-tuck-planche.name: Parallette Tuck Planche
parallette-tuck-planche.description: A progression towards the full planche, performed on parallettes, where the body is supported by the arms with the knees tucked into the chest.

pelvic-tilts.name: Pelvic Tilts
pelvic-tilts.description: A core activation and spinal mobility exercise involving tilting the pelvis anteriorly and posteriorly, often performed lying on the back.

pike-push-up.name: Pike Push-up
pike-push-up.description: A push-up variation performed with the hips high in an inverted 'V' shape, which shifts the emphasis to the shoulders. A progression towards the handstand push-up.

piriformis-stretch-supine.name: Piriformis Stretch (Supine)
piriformis-stretch-supine.description: A stretch for the piriformis muscle in the hip, performed lying on the back, often by crossing one ankle over the opposite knee and pulling towards the chest.

pistol-squat.name: Pistol Squat
pistol-squat.description: An advanced bodyweight exercise consisting of a single-leg squat, requiring significant strength, balance, and mobility.

planche.name: Planche
planche.description: An advanced gymnastics skill where the body is held parallel to the ground, supported only by the hands, requiring incredible straight-arm strength and balance.

plank-to-push-up.name: Plank to Push-up
plank-to-push-up.description: A dynamic exercise where you alternate between a forearm plank and a high plank (push-up) position, challenging core stability and upper body strength.

proprioceptive-close-grip-push-up.name: Proprioceptive Close Grip Push Up
proprioceptive-close-grip-push-up.description: A close-grip push-up performed on an unstable surface to challenge stability, control, and body awareness.

proprioceptive-pause-goblet-squat.name: Proprioceptive Pause Goblet Squat
proprioceptive-pause-goblet-squat.description: A goblet squat with a pause at the bottom, often performed with eyes closed or on an unstable surface to enhance proprioception and stability.

quad-sets-isometric.name: Quad Sets (Isometric)
quad-sets-isometric.description: An isometric strengthening exercise for the quadriceps, involving contracting the muscle without moving the knee joint. Often used in early-stage rehab.

ring-archer-pull-up.name: Ring Archer Pull-up
ring-archer-pull-up.description: A unilateral pull-up variation on gymnastics rings, where one arm pulls while the other extends to the side, similar to an archer drawing a bow.

ring-dip.name: Ring Dip
ring-dip.description: A dip performed on gymnastics rings, which adds an instability component that requires greater strength and stabilization from the shoulders and chest.

ring-muscle-up.name: Ring Muscle-up
ring-muscle-up.description: A muscle-up performed on gymnastics rings, which allows for a more natural transition due to the movement of the rings.

ring-row.name: Ring Row
ring-row.description: An inverted row performed using gymnastics rings, allowing for natural rotation of the hands and adjustable difficulty by changing body angle.

ring-skin-the-cat.name: Ring Skin the Cat
ring-skin-the-cat.description: A fundamental gymnastics mobility exercise on rings, involving passing the feet and hips through the arms and overhead into a hang, then returning.

ring-support-hold.name: Ring Support Hold
ring-support-hold.description: A foundational isometric hold on gymnastics rings, where you support your bodyweight with straight arms, requiring significant stabilization.

sandbag-bear-hug-squat.name: Sandbag Bear Hug Squat
sandbag-bear-hug-squat.description: A squat performed while hugging a sandbag vertically against the torso, intensely engaging the core and upper back.

sandbag-clean.name: Sandbag Clean
sandbag-clean.description: An explosive exercise where a sandbag is lifted from the floor to the shoulder in one powerful motion.

sandbag-over-the-shoulder-carry.name: Sandbag Over-the-Shoulder Carry
sandbag-over-the-shoulder-carry.description: A loaded carry where a heavy sandbag is carried over one shoulder, challenging the core and posterior chain.

sandbag-rotational-lunge.name: Sandbag Rotational Lunge
sandbag-rotational-lunge.description: A lunge that incorporates a rotation of the torso, holding a sandbag to add resistance and challenge the core.

sandbag-shouldering.name: Sandbag Shouldering
sandbag-shouldering.description: The act of lifting a sandbag from the floor and placing it on one shoulder, a fundamental strongman and odd-object lifting skill.

sandbag-zercher-squat.name: Sandbag Zercher Squat
sandbag-zercher-squat.description: A squat performed while holding a sandbag in the crook of the elbows, which heavily taxes the core, upper back, and arms.

scapular-retraction-shoulder-blade-squee.name: Scapular Retraction (Shoulder Blade Squeezes)
scapular-retraction-shoulder-blade-squee.description: A postural exercise focused on squeezing the shoulder blades together to strengthen the rhomboids and mid-traps.

seated-hamstring-stretch.name: Seated Hamstring Stretch
seated-hamstring-stretch.description: A stretch for the hamstrings performed from a seated position, typically by reaching towards the toes with straight legs.

seated-pec-deck-fly.name: Seated Pec Deck Fly
seated-pec-deck-fly.description: An isolation exercise for the chest using a machine where you sit and bring padded levers together in a flying motion.

shoulder-external-rotation-banded.name: Shoulder External Rotation (Banded)
shoulder-external-rotation-banded.description: A prehab/rehab exercise for the rotator cuff muscles, using a resistance band to rotate the arm outward against tension.

shoulder-pendulum-swings.name: Shoulder Pendulum Swings
shoulder-pendulum-swings.description: A gentle range of motion exercise for the shoulder joint, often used in early-stage rehab, involving leaning over and gently swinging the arm.

shrimp-squat.name: Shrimp Squat
shrimp-squat.description: A single-leg squat variation where the non-working leg is bent and held behind the body, similar to a pistol squat but with a different leg position.

side-plank.name: Side Plank
side-plank.description: An isometric core exercise performed on one side to target the oblique muscles and improve lateral stability.

single-kettlebell-alternating-swing.name: Single Kettlebell Alternating Swing
single-kettlebell-alternating-swing.description: A kettlebell swing where the bell is passed from one hand to the other at the apex of each swing.

single-kettlebell-clean-and-press-to-pau.name: Single Kettlebell Clean & Press to Pause Windmill
single-kettlebell-clean-and-press-to-pau.description: A complex flow combining a clean, a press, and then a windmill with a pause, challenging strength, stability, and mobility.

single-kettlebell-clean-and-press.name: Single Kettlebell Clean and Press
single-kettlebell-clean-and-press.description: A classic combination where a kettlebell is cleaned to the rack and then immediately pressed overhead.

single-kettlebell-figure-eight.name: Single Kettlebell Figure Eight
single-kettlebell-figure-eight.description: A dynamic exercise that improves coordination, core stability, and grip strength by passing the kettlebell between and around the legs in a figure-eight motion.

single-kettlebell-front-squat.name: Single Kettlebell Front Squat
single-kettlebell-front-squat.description: A squat performed with a single kettlebell held in the front rack position, creating an offset load that challenges core stability.

single-kettlebell-high-pull.name: Single Kettlebell High Pull
single-kettlebell-high-pull.description: An explosive exercise that involves pulling a kettlebell from a swing position up towards chin height, keeping the elbow high.

single-kettlebell-jerk.name: Single Kettlebell Jerk
single-kettlebell-jerk.description: A powerful lift where you use a double-dip 'jerk' motion with your legs to drive a single kettlebell overhead.

single-kettlebell-overhead-lunge.name: Single Kettlebell Overhead Lunge
single-kettlebell-overhead-lunge.description: A lunge performed while holding a single kettlebell locked out overhead, creating a significant stability challenge.

single-kettlebell-overhead-press.name: Single Kettlebell Overhead Press
single-kettlebell-overhead-press.description: A fundamental upper body strength exercise involving pressing a single kettlebell from the rack position to an overhead lockout.

single-kettlebell-russian-twist.name: Single Kettlebell Russian Twist
single-kettlebell-russian-twist.description: A core exercise targeting the obliques, performed by sitting and twisting the torso from side to side while holding a single kettlebell.

single-kettlebell-swing.name: Single Kettlebell Swing
single-kettlebell-swing.description: The one-handed kettlebell swing, which adds an anti-rotation challenge to the standard two-handed swing.

single-leg-stance-balance.name: Single Leg Stance (Balance)
single-leg-stance-balance.description: A foundational balance exercise that involves standing on one leg for a designated amount of time.

skater-jumps.name: Skater Jumps
skater-jumps.description: A plyometric exercise that involves lateral jumps from one leg to the other, mimicking the motion of a speed skater to build power and agility.

slow-eccentric-floor-skullcrusher.name: Slow Eccentric Floor Skullcrusher
slow-eccentric-floor-skullcrusher.description: A triceps skullcrusher performed on the floor with a focus on a very slow, controlled lowering (eccentric) phase.

slow-eccentric-floor-skullcrusher-to-clo.name: Slow Eccentric Floor Skullcrusher to Close Grip Floor Press
slow-eccentric-floor-skullcrusher-to-clo.description: A triceps-focused complex combining a slow eccentric skullcrusher with a close-grip floor press on each repetition.

slow-eccentric-pause-towel-curls.name: Slow Eccentric Pause Towel Curls
slow-eccentric-pause-towel-curls.description: A bicep curl using a towel for grip, emphasizing a slow lowering phase and a pause to maximize time under tension.

standing-calf-raise.name: Standing Calf Raise
standing-calf-raise.description: An exercise to strengthen the gastrocnemius muscle of the calf by raising the heels from a standing position.

dip.name: Straight Bar Dip
dip.description: A dip performed on a single straight bar, requiring more core stabilization and a different shoulder angle than parallel bar dips.

straight-leg-raise.name: Straight Leg Raise
straight-leg-raise.description: A core and hip flexor exercise performed by lying on the back and lifting one or both legs straight up without bending the knees.

suitcase-deadlift-to-anti-rotation-row.name: Suitcase Deadlift to Anti-Rotation Row
suitcase-deadlift-to-anti-rotation-row.description: A complex that combines a single-arm suitcase deadlift with a row at the top, challenging the core to resist rotation.

superman-extensions.name: Superman Extensions
superman-extensions.description: A bodyweight exercise that strengthens the lower back, glutes, and hamstrings by simultaneously lifting arms and legs off the floor while lying prone.

terminal-knee-extension-tke.name: Terminal Knee Extension (TKE)
terminal-knee-extension-tke.description: A rehabilitation and activation exercise for the quadriceps (specifically the VMO) that focuses on the final few degrees of knee extension, often using a resistance band.

towel-scrunches.name: Towel Scrunches
towel-scrunches.description: An exercise for the intrinsic muscles of the feet, performed by using the toes to scrunch up a towel placed on the floor.

tuck-planche.name: Tuck Planche
tuck-planche.description: A foundational progression for the full planche, where the body is balanced on the hands with the knees tucked tightly into the chest.

twist-sit-up.name: Twist Sit-up
twist-sit-up.description: A sit-up variation that incorporates a torso twist at the top of the movement to engage the oblique muscles.

upper-trapezius-stretch.name: Upper Trapezius Stretch
upper-trapezius-stretch.description: A neck stretch performed by gently tilting the head to one side to lengthen the upper trapezius muscle.

vipr-cylinder-drop-squat.name: ViPR Cylinder Drop Squat
vipr-cylinder-drop-squat.description: A dynamic squat using a ViPR, where the cylinder is dropped and caught, integrating movement and load.

vipr-cylinder-lift.name: ViPR Cylinder Lift
vipr-cylinder-lift.description: A foundational ViPR exercise that involves lifting the cylinder in various planes of motion, often mimicking functional tasks.

vipr-ice-skater.name: ViPR Ice Skater
vipr-ice-skater.description: A lateral movement exercise using the ViPR that mimics the motion of ice skating, building power and agility in the frontal plane.

vipr-lateral-shift-with-rip.name: ViPR Lateral Shift with Rip
vipr-lateral-shift-with-rip.description: A dynamic exercise combining a lateral shift of the ViPR with a powerful push-pull 'rip' motion.

vipr-shoveling.name: ViPR Shoveling
vipr-shoveling.description: A full-body rotational exercise that mimics the motion of shoveling, developing power and coordination through the hips and core.

vipr-thread-the-needle.name: ViPR Thread the Needle
vipr-thread-the-needle.description: A mobility and stability exercise using the ViPR, involving a rotational reach under the body to improve thoracic spine mobility.

wall-handstand.name: Wall Handstand
wall-handstand.description: A handstand performed with the feet resting against a wall for support, used to build strength and confidence for a freestanding handstand.

rehab-wall-push-up.name: Wall Push-up
rehab-wall-push-up.description: A beginner push-up variation where you push against a wall, reducing the amount of bodyweight being lifted.

wall-sit.name: Wall Sit
wall-sit.description: An isometric exercise where you hold a squat position with your back against a wall, primarily strengthening the quadriceps.

rehab-wall-sit-isometric.name: Wall Sit (Isometric)
rehab-wall-sit-isometric.description: An isometric exercise holding a squat position against a wall to build muscular endurance in the quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings.
